attributes.action: Pass a law preventing the resale of event tickets by any company or website
attributes.background: Too many websites and companies exist or promote the resale of event tickets for vastly more than the original face value. No entity should be allowed to purchase by any means any number of tickets if their sole intent is to profit by reselling at inflated prices. The law should protect face values.
attributes.additional_details: Even on the opening day of sale of tickets on sites like Stereoboard, Axn, ticketmaster  it's virtually impossible to find tickets at face value. Instead tickets are immediately sold out, but on the same opening day resell prices are always immediately available at x2, x3 and more than face value. This is outrageous and should be illegal. Only honest fans should be able to buy tickets and the resale should be strictly controlled to face value plus reasonable postage, like standard 1st class.

attributes.action: Transfer reserved power for Drug Classification to the Northern Ireland Assembly
attributes.background: Drug classification powers remain reserved to Westminster. The present system of drug classification is based on historical assumptions, not scientific assessment. The Scottish Government want to consider reforming laws to allow the medicinal use of cannabis. Northern Ireland should do the same
attributes.additional_details: There is strong evidence that medical cannabis helps with chronic pain; spasticity (common, disabling and painful after stroke or brain injury and common in those suffering from multiple sclerosis, as examples); for nausea and vomiting, especially during chemotherapy; and for the management of anxiety. It is also useful in sleep disorders, for appetite stimulation, fibromyalgia, post-traumatic stress disorder, severe childhood epilepsies, bladder problems and even for control of some cancers.

attributes.action: Make MPs resign if they oppose the will of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.background: The British people vote for their preferred members of parliament every five years. During the five year period of government the average British citizen has little influence over decisions and actions of the government of the day.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not so with those of us who are rich and powerful. These people have the means to influence government decisions through lobbying and legal challenge, both not readily available to the general public.
These methods of changing government actions are a challenge to the democratic processes of a nation and introduce inequality into a democratic society. To meet that challenge and rebalance democracy  this petition asks parliament to introduce a bill that holds members of parliament to immediately resign from office if they are found to be opposing the will of the majority of the constituents they represent."

attributes.action: Government to invest 2p per litre of fuel duty to fix potholes on local roads.
attributes.background: Decades of under investment in local road maintenance has resulted in a maintenance bill of £12 billion yet the problem is getting worse as highway authorities reduce their maintenance spend each year. Investing 2p per litre of fuel duty would make an extra £1Bn available each year to resolve this.

attributes.action: Decisions must be issued within 6 months after asylum is claimed
attributes.background:
We deplore the fact that the Home Office is failing to issue decisions about the future of asylum seekers in a timely manner. 
It is clear that many clients are waiting over a year, which contravenes EU guidelines and poses a breach of their human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the Home Office to obey their own guidelines which state that a decision will be made within 6 months after an asylum claim is made, and not the years many are experiencing today.
These people have fled to this country for political or religious reasons and are desperate to work, study and find their own home. They are prevented from doing this while waiting long overdue decisions by the Home Office. 
As a direct result, many suffer from mental health issues including stress, depression, sleeplessness, anxiety and physical problems. 
We therefore call on the Home Office to do everything in their power to give decisions within six months and to issue regular reports on the proportion of cases in which this is achieved.

attributes.action: Private companies doing work for the NHS should display their logos on site.
attributes.background: Much of the NHS's work is done using private companies under the NHS logo.  It would inspire confidence in patients and their families and show responsibility if these companies were required to show their logos alongside that of the NHS in departments where their services are used.

attributes.action: Give our brave Police Officers free access to local or on site Gyms.
attributes.background: Police Officers are required to pass a fitness test every year and also when they apply to take on different roles such as Public Order Policing or firearms roles. We expect our Police to chase people and climb fences. Most importantly we expect them to CATCH the suspects.
attributes.additional_details: Many Police Station based gyms have been closed and cops starting on £19'000 a year are paying over £60 per month in certain areas to keep themselves at the REQUIRED standard. If there is a required standard then surely they should be helped along. We want Gyms back in Police Stations or subsidised Gym memberships for our dedicated and professional Officers.

attributes.action: Stop all Funding to the EU
attributes.background: After the referendum result to leave the EU the UK will no longer be involved in decision Making within the EU as such all funding of the EU should cease

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists under the age of 16 to wear a helmet
attributes.background:
If you ride a bicycle, you should wear a cycle helmet, it's common sense.
Sadly so many children ride on the road without one.
Many serious accidents that occur would be less serious if the child was wearing a cycle helmet.
Cycle helmets are not expensive but they save lives.
attributes.additional_details: Government figures show 16,727 children under the age of 16 were injured on the roads in 2014, a rise of 6.2 per cent compared to the 15,756 injured in 2013.

attributes.action: Provide Orkambi for Cystic Fibrosis patients in England.
attributes.background: Orkambi (ivacaftor and lumacaftor) is a gene therapy based drug used to help treat CF for the most common gene (deltaF508). Use in Cystic patients can reduce lung function decline from 2.3% annually to 1.3% a significant improvement over the course of a cystics life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37795460

attributes.action: Stop MHRA Removing CBD Products From Sale! Patients Will Suffer!
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are at risk of losing the only medicine that works for them. Stop the removal of Cannabidiol (CBD) products from the UK market on November 1st.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst we welcome the move to schedule CBD as a medicine following clinical trials, it must be understood that completely removing it from the market with only 28 days notice is not sufficient time for patients to find alternative ways of maintaining their health. 

CBD is well documented through clinical research to be non-toxic and non-psychoactive and has no recorded negative side effects in humans, as well as being a powerful anti-inflammatory, anti-spasmodic and anti-epilepsy drug.

attributes.action: Call for Government to fund rural school transport
attributes.background: we call for the government to fund all rural home to school transport across the country instead of local councils being responsible for setting their own privatized school bus services, which is causing financial hardship to working families, and severe disruption to public services.
attributes.additional_details: local councils have been given responsibility for setting school bus services, which has allowed them to privatize the bus routes and hike up the prices to almost £1000 per child,per year in some cases. This is causing severe financial hardship to low income families who do not qualify now under the new 'nearest school' changes, as opposed to the old 'catchment school' agreement.we would like all children to travel to school for free, all current school bus services also need improvement.

attributes.action: End the Detention of vulnerable Refugee Children
attributes.background:
The #canyouhearme project wishes to protect vulnerable refugee children from being held in unsuitable detention facilities that do not safeguard their wellbeing.

We call the Government to account for their promises to better safeguard and end the detention of innocent children.
attributes.additional_details:
The Trump American Refugee Ban has caused outrage around the globe. We as UK citizens want to show an act of solidarity against the treatment of young child refugees being detained, who merely seek sanctuary after escaping terrible and unimaginable terror.

Help their voices be heard.

attributes.action: Offer a unilateral guarantee of the rights of EU citizens in the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: More than 900,000 EU citizens are resident in the UK; making a positive contribution to our dynamic, multi-cultural society.  Offering a unilateral guarantee of their rights, without waiting for a reciprocal guarantee will demonstrate to our EU partners our good faith in Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
No human being deserves to be used a pawn in negotiations between nations.  We have the opportunity to set a positive tone as we engage in Brexit negotiations.  No one seriously believes that a reciprocal offer will not be made; but it's hard for the EU to move fast. 

The UK doesn't have to wait.  These people are our friends, neighbours, colleagues and lovers.  Let's make it clear the kind of nation that we want to be.

attributes.action: Get the M.o.D. to agree to a last minute bid to purchase the ex-HMS Illustrious
attributes.background: There is a new consortium currently negotiating with the M.o.D. with respect to purchasing the ex-Royal Navy Aircraft Carrier HMS Illustrious, which if allowed to proceed, would save her from the scrapyard and instead see her preserved as a heritage attraction for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The funds necessary to cover all aspects of the purchase are in place, thus all that is required is for the M.o.D. to agree, and this iconic ship - the last surviving Invincible Class Aircraft Carrier, can be secured as an asset for the nation, for present and future generations to visit. Despite having received several high value heritage bids, the MoD instead agreed a much lower value scrap deal, clearly not the best financial option for the taxpayer. She is still en route under tow to Turkey.

attributes.action: High sentences on gang bullying
attributes.background: As parents we need the help from the government to reduce the the amount of gang bullying on the streets where there is filming taking place of these children being beaten up for the fun of it. With a strong punishment now in court for this kind of behaviour.

attributes.action: Request the Home Office to remove "Place of birth" from British passports
attributes.background: Following recent US/Trump policy to ban Muslims/individuals, many British citizens will be affected adversely due to their place of birth as they face various complications. This is a violation of human rights & an act of discrimination when 2 citizens of same country are treated differently.
attributes.additional_details:
Travelers seeking to enter the United States for business or tourism or in transit for less than 90 days may be eligible to travel to the United States visa free under the Visa Waiver Program if they meet specific requirements. This will affect those British citizens whose place of birth is one of those listed countries (e.g. high visa cost, length visa processing, potential of being treated differently by officials once in the US, etc.) 
https://uk.usembassy.gov/visas/visa-waiver-pro

attributes.action: Provide and fund a home education for 16-19 yrs olds with chronic conditions
attributes.background: The age of participation is 18 but for those with chronic conditions such as PoTS, CFS/ME, EDS there is no funding for home tution. If they fail their GCSEs they are unable to retake, there is not the provision to do A Levels at home. Few have an EHCP as it is considered health not education.
attributes.additional_details:
In a letter from Edward Timpson MP dated 5-11-15, he states that section 68, Education & Skills Act 2008 requires local authorities to make available support that will encourage & assist the participation young people in education or training up to the age 19. 
Without an EHCP there is no transition into post 16 education, LEAs are not made accountable for those unable to attend education or work as an apprentice. LEAs must be held accountable to provide education and/or apprenticeship for all.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Open an enquiry into the abuse of psychoactive substances (NPS) within prison
attributes.background: The growing use of new and largely non-detectable psychoactive substances (NPS) is leading to increased violence, bullying, debt and medical emergencies requiring hospitalisation. We demand a thorough enquiry immediately to investigate the claims made in the Secret Lives of Prisons Documentary
attributes.additional_details:
People in prison, prisoners and staff, are
less safe than they were five years ago. This year more
prisoners were murdered, killed themselves, self harmed
and were assaulted than ever before
Serious assaults in prison have more than
doubled in the last three years. 
Rates of self-harm are at the highest level ever
recorded. There were 32,313 self-harm incidents in
2015—a nearly 40% rise in just two years.
We believe this is a direct result of overcrowding and  NPS. We demand an immediate enquiry

attributes.action: Appoint ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.background: There should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. It is my proposal that all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.additional_details: In 1969, John Lennon sang “All we are saying is Give Peace a Chance”. In 2017, all I am saying is give peace a better chance. I believe there should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. Following the appointment of Fabian Hamilton to the position of Shadow Minister for Peace and Disarmament – a post created in 2016 by Labour Leader Jeremy Corbyn – it is my proposal that from now on all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.

attributes.action: Create a benefit for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: Currently in the U.K. there is a pension and a one off payment of £2000 of your partner dies. Well what if your child dies? Benefits for bereaved parents would give them time to grieve after loss.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents should not be struggling to make ends meet and worrying about how to pay the mortgage after the death of a child. 
They should be given a minimum of 6 months paid leave if their child dies, to come to terms with their loss. This would create a better working environment in the long run and better mental health for the parent/s affected. Also aftercare counselling should be provided for them to aid them in their wellbeing.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: Include Halal and Kosher slaughter in the Animal Welfare Act 2006
attributes.background: In times of equality and social integration, it is wrong to exempt the slaughter practises of Halal and Kosher from the Animal Welare Act.
attributes.additional_details: The exemption is currently published in the Animal Welfare Act 2006

attributes.action: Equality for mental health
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, have joined together to mount a campaign aimed at persuading the Government to help reduce the suffering of those with mental ill health by increasing investment into the provision of mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
As ministers make final decisions on the Spending Review, we urge them to treat mental health equally with physical health. We ask for the same right to timely access to evidence based treatment as those with physical health problems.

We accept, this will require additional investment in mental health services. But we are strongly persuaded that investment in mental health services will lead to significant returns by reducing the burden on the NHS through the improved wellbeing of our citizens.

attributes.action: Prevent councils from moving homeless people into other areas without permission
attributes.background:
Private companies are buying up housing stock, evicting the tenants, then offering the properties to the local council as temporary accommodation for the homeless.

If the council says "no," the firm offers the properties to another local authority to move their homeless people into.
attributes.additional_details:
In Peterborough, a private firm evicted tenants and their families from 74 homes on a single estate then offered the properties to Peterborough City Council as temporary accommodation.

The firm told the council that if it did not take up the properties, they would be used by a London borough for its homeless people.

This practice is going on around the country and is causing misery for many people. 

See:

http://tinyurl.com/zf9atnv

http://tinyurl.com/zsyc6x6

http://tinyurl.com/hro3dqp

attributes.action: Ringfence Science & Research Funding After Brexit.
attributes.background: For centuries the UK has been a driving force in terms of Science and innovation and we believe that it would be best for us all if we guarantee jobs and funding for our science sector.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it is essential that any money being lost from UK Science should be guaranteed by the government. 

We also believe that the UK should continue to contribute to international collaberations such as the European Space Agency and CERN.

We believe that education should be available to all at a cost that will not cause financial difficulties.

attributes.action: EU citizens to not be allowed to vote in any Scottish independence referendum
attributes.background: EU citzens should not be allowed to vote in future Scottish Referendums it be for Scottish/Scottish living outside Scotland only.

attributes.action: Stop the Government sending £1.3 billion in foreign aid to China.
attributes.background: The Government plan to send £1.3 billion in foreign aid to help China's elderly is immoral when our own Social Care sector is failing. This money should be redirected into our own country.

attributes.action: Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow the electorate to dismiss MPs
attributes.background:
Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow for fresh elections when 40% of the last turnout at a constituency election signs a petition calling for that.

The British public demand the means to remove our MPs if they are not acting in the interest of the British people
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, prospective members of parliament and political parties of all denominations, have lied to the British public in order to get elected. 

The only way to ensure that those elected to office, keep their word once chosen to speak for the people, is to give the public the right to sack their MPs or government in much the same way that you would sack a negligent or under performing employee.

Many MP's are openly disregarding the will of the people and should therefore be removed.

attributes.action: Make stillbirth training mandatory for student midwifes before work placements
attributes.background: Many midwifes end up going out onto placement in hospitals without any experience or knowledge in how to deal with the emotional effects of stillbirth on parents. By making stillbirth training mandatory it will improve services provided to the parents they are dealing with in maternity wards.

attributes.action: Fathers should automatically be granted 50% custody of their children by law
attributes.background: At present a father needs to fight to have 50% access to their child. A child that is legally a mother and fathers. A child needs a father just as much as a mother and the current legislation is not only stuck in the dark ages but favours considerably the mother. This needs to change.

attributes.action: The housing crisis is creating homelessness; we need lower rents and more houses
attributes.background: We want the Government to build more houses because the more houses there are, the cheaper they will be. The Government should introduce a new rent cap so that people can afford a house to live in. It's not a laughing matter and the Government cannot let this carry on because it is destroying lives!
attributes.additional_details:
We are class 5 and we are proud to present  Saint Mary's Catholic Primary School's petition. Homelessness is not a problem; it is a crisis. This needs to be addressed immediately.

So we do hope that this turns into reality because homelessness is no joke. How would you feel if you were homeless? Who would you turn to in your hour of need? Why is the Government not taking responsibility for this disturbing crisis? 

Sign this petition today or it could be you living on the streets tomorrow.

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: I want to see a mandatory Driving ban for using a mobile device when driving.
attributes.background: People are being killed on the roads in the UK due to irresponsible motorists using mobile devices whilst driving. The law should be changed to ensure that any motorist using a mobile device whilst driving should receive an automatic driving disqualification of 6 months for a first time offence.
attributes.additional_details: A driver who recently killed three children and a woman whilst he was distracted whilst using his mobile device received a ten year custodial sentence. He had previously been warned about using a mobile device whilst driving by his employers yet he still continued to flout the law.

attributes.action: Ban the use of wild animals in circuses in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In 2012 the Government made a commitment to ban the use of wild animals in travelling circuses before the end of 2015, it is now 2017 and there is still no ban.
With 94.5% of the public wanting to see this practice relegated to the history books, is it not time the U.K. followed suit?
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why a ban is needed :
Wild animals do not jump through rings of fire, balance on balls or stand on their front legs voluntarily.
Circuses travel nearly all year round so the complex needs of wild animals can never be adequately met. 
Many undercover investigations have revealed evidence of circuses mistreating their animals.

attributes.action: Control the population of seabirds for health, safety and environmental reasons
attributes.background: The Scarborough News is campaigning for a change in the law to manage the populations of seabirds including kittiwakes in the interest of public safety, health and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of control over the seabird population has led to dangerous food-grabbing swoops on men, women and children, and the creation of a serious scale of mess and stench of droppings in shopping areas, and on pavements, shop buildings and the general environment.

attributes.action: Give grieving parents of a stillborn baby a birth certificate
attributes.background:
We lost our gorgeous son Bobby at 41 weeks. We never expected to be told there was no heartbeat.
He was perfect in every way yet we left the hospital a day later with a box and a death certifate. No birth certificate just a death certificate. As if our little boy was never here...
attributes.additional_details:
Looseing a child at any age is heartbreaking. You never get over the pain of leaving your child behind. It's not natural to any parent to part with them.
To go in to labour anxious and excited to meet ur tiny baby, to then have to leave the hospital empty handed. 
Your then told you don't get a birth certificate. Your baby isn't registered a child. 
All babies, no matter how long they have been here for, deserve to be recognised as a person. 
It's time this became the norm! 
Help all us grieving parents out there to make a simple change that would make the world of difference to a horrendous situation.

attributes.action: Make sharing content of disabled children with the intent to humiliate illegal.
attributes.background: The number of hate crime incidences against disabled people are increasing. This is fuelled by sharing disparaging social media content. Disabled children often don't have a voice to defend themselves so should have special protection against behaviour which feeds dangerous negative attitudes.

attributes.action: Individual Petitions should get Individual Replies, not repeat templates.
attributes.background: Many anti Brexit petitions have been written and supported by at least 10,000 people therefore requiring a Government response. The Government's response has simply been a repeated template churned out with little thought.  This undermines the whole process and the point of petitions.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to space permitting, here's an extract from the repeated template:

On 23 June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union in a referendum provided for by an Act of Parliament.
The Government is committed to implementing the democratic outcome of the referendum.
The Government was clear in the run up to the EU referendum that we would honour the choice made by the people of the UK on 23 June 2016. We will maintain that commitment: the UK will leave the EU.
etc, etc, etc.

attributes.action: More real term funding for schools, based on a per pupil funding formula
attributes.background: The government is imposing real term funding cuts on schools by freezing per-pupil funding while inflation and cost of employer pension and national insurance contributions increase. This affects all schools and academies alike. Without further funding schools will lose £3bn in real terms by 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
Wirral UNISON and other school unions do not want children in this country to miss out on a decent education, supplied by dedicated teachers and support staff with sufficient resources.
Average primary school cut is £87,000 or £339 per pupil.
Average secondary cut is £405,000 or £477 per pupil.
Visit http://www.schoolcuts.org.uk/#/ for more information.
Early indications had shown Wirral losing £10,759,698, figures now show this to be £15,696,153. 
That is 421 teachers or 872 support staff !

attributes.action: Reinstate Legal Aid for family law matters.
attributes.background: Many parents are struggling to arrange contact with their children following separation, and do not have the funds to employ legal representation. Dealing with the separation is hard enough, without trying to cope with the administrative side of things as well.

attributes.action: Make Security Industry Authority reform systems, processes and payment schemes
attributes.background: The SIA was designed to improve security standards across the UK and enforce the PSI act, however many people in the industry are unhappy with the pricing structure and lack of support given by the SIA. A review of the ACS pricing is required to make it affordable to small businesses
attributes.additional_details:
The ACS is overpriced for many smaller companies and is a requirement of tenders, therefore the scheme is damaging small businesses.

The SIA advised thousands of companies to proceed with ISO 9001 or ACS in preparation for business licence - these clients were misinformed and want a review of how this happened.

More support and training needed, not fines. People feel they are just interested in money

Internal computer system isn't fit for purpose 

Phone lines to be brought online for public

attributes.action: Stop the concentration of Heathrow's Flight Paths.
attributes.background: The Department of Transport have made the Heathrow' flight paths concentrated. Meaning some people will be getting all the noise from aircraft coming in and out of Heathrow. There should be a fairer system.
attributes.additional_details:
Concentrated flight paths are very bad for people's physical and mental health. Some people will have rented or brought their homes in peaceful locations but are now finding there is a concentrated flight path over their heads. 

Unwanted noise increases stress levels in the body, that can cause sleep disturbance and even cause issues like heart disease. Known mental health issues through unwanted loud continued noise are starting to becoming more common due to these concentrated flight paths.

attributes.action: People with permanent disabilities can apply for disability benefits immediately
attributes.background: Disabled benefits like PIP (formerly DLA), the Personal Independence Payment, make people wait 3 months before they can apply. Many other forms of help such as blue badges also require PIP as a form of proof of disability. Disabilities such as the loss of a limb should be allowed PIP immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
About PIP
https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

attributes.action: Hold a public vote on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model
attributes.background: In June the UK electorate voted to leave the EU by a narrow majority. It has since become clear that there was no clear plan defined and little information given about the options. A public decision can only be valid if a clear intent of the direction the government wishes to take us is proposed.
attributes.additional_details:
The outcome of the advisory referendum on 23rd June means that the government must now propose defined exit plans for terms of leaving the EU.

However, leaving the EU is too momentous a decision to proceed without a clear understanding of the proposed model.

We call for a public vote to be held before Article 50 is invoked, on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model with impartial assessments of the consequences of each option, including the option of staying in the EU.

attributes.action: Condemn Trump's Muslim travel ban & accept those affected by it in the UK.
attributes.background: We ask the Prime Minister to condemn President Trump's orders banning citizens of Iraq, Iran, Syria, Yemen, Libya, Sudan and Somalia from entering the USA and preventing Muslim refugees from travelling to the USA. We also ask that the UK accepts all those turned away by the USA during this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
On Holocaust Memorial Day of all days, Donald Trump signed Executive Orders that amount to a de facto ban on Muslims and refugees entering the United States. On the same day, the UK Prime Minister met with him and proclaimed the strength of the friendship between our nations. Friends don't let friends enforce a bigoted, ineffective, paranoid and religiously-motivated border policy. 

The UK should model good humanitarian behaviour and accept all of those turned away by the US during this crisis.

attributes.action: Give an extra £350M each week to the NHS on the same day as serving Article 50.
attributes.background: This was a significant promise made during the referendum, and should be delivered.

attributes.action: DWP and its contractors to have mandatory training in understanding Autism.
attributes.background: Since the Conservative Govt have been in power and the treasury have stated that major changes will happen for AUSTERITY. Myself and many families looking after Autistic children/adults have been made to feel that AUTISM is not a disability. Many families are struggling with the loss of benefits.
attributes.additional_details: As a mother of 2 Autistic children I have joined many groups online.  Reading stories of family's being told they can no longer have benefits with a diagnosis of Autism. We need change to make DWP and its contractors aware that Autism is a lifelong, developmental disability that affects how a person communicates with and relates to other people, and how they experience the world around them, Without these benefits they cannot have carers or support please STOP AUSTERITY WITH AUTISM

attributes.action: Scrap plans for HS2 and invest the money in our Armed Forces and NHS.
attributes.background: A country the size of Britain does not need this type of rail service. People on the average wage won't be able afford to use this just rich business people. This money spent on our NHS & Armed Forces would enable us to rebuild them to there former glorys!
